s2.title: FOP TODO
s2.p: Core Features - these are the areas that are important to getting fop to be useable for general use.
Processing improvements - these are mainly things that can be improved in the way fop works, eg. resources usage, pdf output etc.
Enhancements - these are added functionality that might be useful, no comment is made about the suitability of these suggestions.

s3.title: Layout
s3.p: This is the crucial part to getting FOP to make it to the next step.

s3.title: Webstart Demo
s3.p: a demo using Java Webstart that runs the awt viewer and supports linking from an index

s3.title: Website
s3.p: Need to improve the website to better demonstrate what fop is and can do. Examples, screenshots, pdf documents.

s3.title: Property Support
s3.p: Currently all properties are in the xml file. We need to handle all default values properly (including ones that change depending on the element) and all possible values.
To see if a property is implemented then look in the src/codegen/foproperties.xml file.
To see if a particular element uses this property then look in the element code. This is generally found in the package org.apache.fop.fo.flow.*.

s3.title: Property Resolution
s3.p: This is support for the functions in property values that evaluate some expression. Better support for resolution including support for "inherit" and values with lists.

s3.title: Validity Checking
s3.p: Check the validity of children for a particular element to ensure there are no invalid children. Should help process the layout better.

s3.title: Image Handling
s3.p: Needs to be a bit more solid. Allow for direct insertion of jpeg images in svg into the pdf.

s3.title: Configuration
s3.p: Support for avalon. Better multithread handling.

s3.title: More PDF Outputs
s3.p: Support for streaming and linearized pdf to help with different deployement of pdf documents.

s3.title: i18n in awt viewer
s3.p: Use proper i18n handling for awt viewer.

s3.title: better abstraction of rendering classes
s3.p: put all common rendering processes into an abstract class that has no dependancies on any specific renderers.

s3.title: font handling
s3.p: Need better handling of font names, since a font can have several names.

s3.title: user agent
s3.p: A user agent (or some similar thing) is needed to handle adjustable values, such as setting dpi resolution.

s3.title: input from url
s3.p: be able to specify a url as the input fo (or xml, xsl) documents.

s3.title: improve text handling in svg
s3.p: support (better) the direct rendering of text into pdf graphics and other similair outputs

s3.title: stream encoding
s3.p: Support for different encoding on different types of streams in pdf document. For example images and text.

s3.title: PDF Graphic State
s3.p: Add support for the pdf graphic state for use with transparency in pdf 1.4.

s3.title: svg features
s3.p: Currently patterns and gradients are not generated properly
